summary: The TypeScript SDK's WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError does not include the runId when the server provides it, even though the SDK already has the capability to extract this information from protobuf-encoded error details.
userImpact: Users cannot easily identify which workflow execution is already running when encountering this error, making debugging and recovery more difficult.
rootCause: The TS SDK decodes protobuf error details but does not extract or include the runId field in the WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError exception.
proposedFix: Extract the runId from protobuf-encoded error details and include it in the thrown WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedError.
keyQuote: The runId is stored as part of the protobuf-encoded error details, which the TS SDK already knows how to decode.
